lines.text: [Dodger is reading the financial pages of the newspaper in his prison cell]
Cor, the bottom's dropped right out of Colonial Cocoa. When you knock off any money, lads, never put it on the Stock Exchange - I'll tell you that for nothing.
[Fred's wife has brought in a young baby when she visits Fred in prison]
How old is he now, my love?
[Fred looks suspicious and counts on his fingers]
But I've been in here nearly two years.
Oh yes, Fred. But you sent me some *lovely* letters.
[Dodger, Jelly and Lennie have escaped in a prison van with the help of Ethel and Mrs Price who have now joined them in the van]

[to Dodger]
Oh Dodger, dear, it's lovely to see you again. I do hope everything goes all right. We'll have a lovely honeymoon.

[ironically]
Marvellous - you in Holloway, him in Dartmoor.
